New Records: India scored the third total above 400 in the World Cup
Iyer and Rahul forged a 208-run partnership – the highest fourth-wicket stand in World Cups
Key Match Events: Sharma and Gill hit boundaries at will to give India a superb platform with 91 runs in the powerplay

Gill was severe on the bowlers with three fours and four sixes, but the world’s top-ranked batsman found a fielder in the deep while taking on a short ball from Paul van Meekeren after reaching his 12th half-century
Bas de Leede had Sharma caught at wide long-on
Kohli and Iyer took India past 200 runs in the 29th over with a 71-run stand
Roelof van der Merwe briefly silenced fans by breaking Kohli's stumps with a flatter delivery
The Netherlands chipped away and were rewarded but never threatened to win
Post-Match Reflections: Sharma, the India captain, said, ‘Honestly, since we started the tournament it was always about taking one game at a time and playing that game well. That’s what everyone did. We’re very pleased with how we played in these nine games. We’ve been clinical from game one. That’s because different individuals have stepped up at different points.’

Iyer, the player of the match, said, ‘I hurt my arm on 95 so I had to settle down and take a bit of time. My last few innings have given me a lot of confidence. It wasn’t an easy wicket to start on, it was playing tacky, a bit two-paced so I knew I had to make the most of a good start.’
Miscellaneous Highlights: India put the Netherlands to the sword after winning the toss and opting to bat
India thrash Netherlands by 160 runs: Cricket World Cup 2023 – as it happened
Hosts make it nine wins from nine in the group stage
India face New Zealand in the semi-finals on Wednesday
Others: The Netherlands chipped away and were rewarded but never threatened to win

Mohammed Siraj (two for 29) overcame a throat injury sustained while dropping a catch to dazzle alongside Kuldeep Yadav (two for 41), Jasprit Bumrah (two for 33) and Ravindra Jadeja (two for 49) to secure victory for India
